009package Ch08_Binary_Regions;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
014import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
015import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
016import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.moments.FlusserMoments;
019import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
020import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
021import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
022import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegion;
023import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegionSegmentation;
024import imagingbook.common.regions.Contour;
025import imagingbook.common.regions.RegionContourSegmentation;
026import imagingbook.sampleimages.kimia.KimiaCollage;
027
028import java.awt.Color;
029import java.awt.Font;
030import java.util.Comparator;
031import java.util.List;
032
033import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
034
035/**
036 * <p>
037 * This ImageJ plugin calculates and lists the 11 scale and rotation invariant Flusser moments for the binary regions
038 * contained in the given image. See Sec. 8.6.5 of [1] for additional details. The plugin expects a binary image (with 0
039 * background and non-zero foreground). A sample image is automatically loaded if no other image is currently open.
040 * </p>
041 * <p>
042 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
043 * (2022).
044 * </p>
045 *
046 * @author WB
047 * @version 2022/12/28
048 */
049public class Flusser_Moments_From_Binary_Regions implements PlugInFilter {
050
051    private static int MIN_REGION_SIZE = 100;
052    private static int MAX_REGION_COUNT = 30;
053    private static boolean MARK_OUTER_CONTOURS = true;
054
055    private static final Font MarkerFont = new Font(Font.SANS_SERIF, Font.BOLD, 12);
056    private static final Color MarkerColor = Color.blue;
057
058    private ImagePlus im;
059
060    /**
061     * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open.
062     */
063    public Flusser_Moments_From_Binary_Regions() {
064        if (noCurrentImage()) {
065            DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(KimiaCollage.ShapeCollage1);  // Kimia216.bird02
066        }
067    }
068
069    public int setup(String arg0, ImagePlus im) {
070        this.im = im;
071        return DOES_8G + DOES_8C;
072    }
073
074    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
075        if (!runDialog())
076            return;
077
078        BinaryRegionSegmentation segmenter = new RegionContourSegmentation((ByteProcessor) ip);
079        List<BinaryRegion> regions = segmenter.getRegions(true);
080        if (regions.isEmpty()) {
081            IJ.log("No regions found!");
082            return;
083        }
084
085        IJ.log("Regions found: " + regions.size());
086        regions.sort(Comparator.comparingDouble(r -> r.getCenter().getY()));    // sort regions by Y-coordinates
087
088        ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter();
089        ola.setStroke(new ColoredStroke(0.5, Color.green));
090        ola.setFont(MarkerFont);
091        ola.setTextColor(MarkerColor);
092        int i = 0;
093        for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
094            if (r.getSize() >= MIN_REGION_SIZE) {
095                IJ.log("Region " + i + ", size = " + r.getSize());
096                Contour oc = r.getOuterContour();
097                ola.addShape(oc.getPolygonPath());
098                Pnt2d c = r.getCenter();
099                ola.addText(c.getX(), c.getY(), "R" + i);
100                double[] moments = new FlusserMoments(r).getInvariantMoments();
101                print(moments);
102                i++;
103                if (i > MAX_REGION_COUNT)
104                    break;
105            }
106        }
107        im.setOverlay(ola.getOverlay());
108    }
109
110    private void print(double[] moments) {
111        for (int i = 0; i < moments.length; i++) {
112            IJ.log("   p" + (i+1) + " = " + moments[i]);
113        }
114    }
115
116    // ------------------------------------------------------
117
118    private boolean runDialog() {
119        GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
120        if (im.isInvertedLut()) {
121            gd.setInsets(0, 0, 0);
122            gd.addMessage("NOTE: Image has inverted LUT (0 = white)!");
123        }
124        gd.addNumericField("Minimum region size (pixels)", MIN_REGION_SIZE);
125        gd.addNumericField("Maximum region count", MAX_REGION_COUNT);
126        gd.addCheckbox("Mark outer contours", MARK_OUTER_CONTOURS);
127
128        gd.showDialog();
129        if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
130            return false;
131        }
132
133        MIN_REGION_SIZE = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
134        MAX_REGION_COUNT = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
135        MARK_OUTER_CONTOURS = gd.getNextBoolean();
136        return true;
137    }
138
139}
